PLAHIS Planning Application Reference: TREE2020/00045--- Address: 163 Stanley RoadCarshaltonSM5 4LW--- Proposal: T1 Sycamore - Crown thin 15%,Crown lift to  6m,  Crown cleanT 2/3 Sycamores - Selectively reduce over hanging branches by 4 Meters. Crown lift to 8m. Crown cleanT 4/5  Sycamores - Cut back over hanging branches where possible by 4-5M. Crown Clean.T 6/7 Sycamores - Crown thin 15%. T 8/9 Sycamores - Crown thin 15%. Cut back over hanging branches 4-5M. Crown clean.--- Status: SPLIT--- Decision: SPLIT--- Date Decision Issued: 30-JUN-20---

PLAHIS Planning Application Reference: TREE2018/00063--- Address: 27 Kenny DriveCarshaltonSM5 4PH--- Proposal: All trees are SycamoresT1 (Sycamore) - Cut back 1M beyond boundaryBranches are close to roof (Damage caused in windy weather)Some tiles have broken from either falling branches or branches banging on roof in the windT2, T3, T4 (all Sycamores) - Cut back 1M beyond boundaryExcessive shading of rear garden, bird mess constantly being dropped on patio, shed, artificial grass and clothes on washing line.My daughter is crawling around and I cant let her in the garden until I have jet washed all the patio and grass first. I'm constantly battling to keep it clean and hygienic for her.Some branches have fallen in high winds and there is also damage to my roof below T2. Broken tiles.I would greatly appreciate being able to address some of these issues and be able to enjoy my garden and some of the sunshine, also hoping my newly planted shrubs and flowers will grow better as a result of being far more less shaded throughout the summer.--- Status: APPRET--- Decision: --- Date Decision Issued: ---

ARCH
TPOPOL Ref: 319 - Status: CONF

description: T1 + T2 - Sycamore - Fell. T3-T8 - Sycamore - Reduce lateral growth by approx 2-2.5m.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: The Tree Works that are carried shall not exceed the description of the Tree Works amounts as described in Section 7 of the Application Form that was submitted to the Council. Reason: To ensure the preservation of the amenity value and health of the tree(s).

All tree works will be carried out in accordance with British Standard 3998: 2010 Tree work. Recommendations. In order to carry out the tree works to BS 3998:2010 there will be only the removal of secondary and tertiary branches, no primary branches. All finalpruning cuts on the branches will not exceed a third of the diameter of the main stem of the tree when measured at 1.5 meters above ground level. Reason: To ensure that the works are carried out in accordance with good arboricultural practice.

This decision notice for Tree Works is only valid for 2 years from the date of this decision or until the work is completed, whichever is the sooner. Reason: In order to ensure that the work is carried out whilst still appropriate and in accordance with the time period within the legislation and regulations.

A replacement tree for protected Sycamore T1 and T2 shall be planted in accordance with the following specifications: Tree Species: Birch, Rowan, Hornbeam or Beech. Quantity: x 1 Size/Height: 10-12cm stem circumference at 1m, to be planted in accordance with the recommendations in British Standard 8545:  Trees from nursery to independence in the landscape - Recommendations (2014). Root ball or container grown is acceptable. Location: In the same position as the original tree, or in an alternative position to be agreed in writing by the Council. Deadline: Within 3 months following the removal of the original tree, or an alternative date to be agreed in writing by the Council. The tree shall thereafter be maintained for a period of three years and in that time shall not be pruned or removed without the written consent of the Council.
